page.title: 04An Eversley Public Footpath
page.content: We went for a walk from the{ {Eversley Footpath Book}to look at the natural history around us. We crossed{ {Kingsley Road}and went over a stile towards the vineyard. The vines had new shoots and leaves on them. There are many rabbits in this part of Eversley. When we came to the forest we discovered that it was mixed, with mostly oak trees but also birch, alder, hazel and white beam. We came to a ditch with many holes in the bank. We have seen rabbits and water-rats there. We saw a yellow frog which we have identified as a common frog, as they can be yellow sometimes.We found flowers including speedwell, stitchwort, buttercups, daisies and bluebells.
